DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Cortisol Measurement Outcome Upper Limit of Normal 1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of the serum cortisol measurement in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Cortisol Measurement Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._The determination of the amount of cortisol present in a sample._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:The determination of the amount of cortisol present in a sample.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
The determination of the amount of cortisol present in a sample.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave per request by D.Lawrence. mc 6/2/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
